channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Tesla profits have plummeted. Elon Musk remains all-in on robotaxis
item.description: Tesla's sales are down. It's slashing car prices and laying off staff. Yet CEO Elon Musk remains bullish on a future that's self-driving and battery-powered.
item.content:encoded:
Tesla's sales are down. It's slashing car prices and laying off staff. Yet CEO Elon Musk remains bullish on a future that's self-driving and battery-powered.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Noroozi)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Trump to score additional $1.2 billion windfall thanks to his Truth Social app
item.description: Trump is getting additional shares in his social media company, Trump Media & Technology Group, as part of his current agreement. He still can't cash in yet though.
item.content:encoded:
Trump is getting additional shares in his social media company, Trump Media & Technology Group, as part of his current agreement. He still can't cash in yet though.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: Scrambled GPS: the New Electronic Fog of War
item.description: Two stories of how our reliance on GPS becomes problematic in regions experiencing war. In Ukraine, the power grid's use of GPS becomes a liability. And in the Middle East today, GPS "spoofing" causes a variety of issues from plane navigation to internet dating.
item.content:encoded: Two stories of how our reliance on GPS becomes problematic in regions experiencing war. In Ukraine, the power grid's use of GPS becomes a liability. And in the Middle East today, GPS "spoofing" causes a variety of issues from plane navigation to internet dating.
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: A hunk of space junk crashed through a Florida man's roof. Who should pay to fix it?
item.description: "It was not like anything I had ever seen before," Alejandro Otero says. It turned out his home was hit by debris from the International Space Station that had been circling the Earth for three years.
item.content:encoded: "It was not like anything I had ever seen before," Alejandro Otero says. It turned out his home was hit by debris from the International Space Station that had been circling the Earth for three years.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: U.S. bans noncompete agreements for nearly all jobs
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission has voted to ban employment agreements that typically prevent workers from leaving their companies for competitors, or starting competing businesses of their own.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Trade Commission has voted to ban employment agreements that typically prevent workers from leaving their companies for competitors, or starting competing businesses of their own.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Report on UNRWA concludes Israel has not provided evidence of employees' militancy
item.description: An independent review commissioned by the United Nations did not have a mandate to investigate Israel's other claim that a dozen UNRWA employees took part in the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.
item.content:encoded:
An independent review commissioned by the United Nations did not have a mandate to investigate Israel's other claim that a dozen UNRWA employees took part in the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.

(Image credit: Mohammed Salem)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Justice Department pays $138 million over FBI failures in Larry Nassar case
item.description: The DOJ settlement goes to 139 victims of Larry Nassar, the disgraced team doctor of USA Gymnastics who sexually assaulted elite and Olympic gymnasts, after the FBI failed to promptly investigate.
item.content:encoded:
The DOJ settlement goes to 139 victims of Larry Nassar, the disgraced team doctor of USA Gymnastics who sexually assaulted elite and Olympic gymnasts, after the FBI failed to promptly investigate.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Pro-Palestinian encampments and protests spread on college campuses across the U.S.
item.description: After dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters were arrested at Columbia, Yale and NYU, students at colleges from Massachusetts to Minnesota to California are erecting encampments in solidarity.
item.content:encoded:
After dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters were arrested at Columbia, Yale and NYU, students at colleges from Massachusetts to Minnesota to California are erecting encampments in solidarity.

(Image credit: Scott Eisen)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: What's at stake as the Supreme Court hears Idaho case about abortion in emergencies
item.description: The Supreme Court will consider the question: Should doctors treating pregnancy complications follow state or federal law if the laws conflict? Here's how the case could affect women and doctors.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court will consider the question: Should doctors treating pregnancy complications follow state or federal law if the laws conflict? Here's how the case could affect women and doctors.

(Image credit: Tom Brenner for The Washington Post)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Gaza solidarity protests sweep U.S. colleges; SCOTUS tackles Starbucks union case
item.description: Tensions are high as campus protests over the war in Gaza stretch across the U.S. The Supreme Court will hear a case about pro-union Starbucks employees.
item.content:encoded:
Tensions are high as campus protests over the war in Gaza stretch across the U.S. The Supreme Court will hear a case about pro-union Starbucks employees.

(Image credit: Alex Kent)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen
